<Link id="l00009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This file declares routines for folding instructions into constants when all</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// operands are constants, for example &quot;sub i32 1, 0&quot; -&gt; &quot;1&quot;.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Also, to supplement the basic VMCore ConstantExpr simplifications,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="13"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// this file declares some additional folding routines that can make use of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="14"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// DataLayout information. These functions cannot go in VMCore due to library</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="15"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// dependency issues.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="16"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// ConstantFoldInstOperands - Attempt to constant fold an instruction with the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// specified operands.  If successful, the constant result is returned, if not,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// null is returned.  Note that this function can fail when attempting to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// fold instructions like loads and stores, which have no constant expression</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// form.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// In some cases, constant folding may return one value chosen from a set of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// multiple legal return values. For example, the exact bit pattern of NaN</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// results is not guaranteed. Using such a result is usually only valid if</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// all uses of the original operation are replaced by the constant-folded</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// result. The \\p AllowNonDeterministic parameter controls whether this is</span></CodeLine>
